div1.p: Gould sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Alice B. Gould to Howard A. Kelly, July 30, 1907
div1.opener:
acknowledged.
[C/ American Colonial Bank
San Juan, Puerto Rico]
July 30th 1907
Howard A Kelly Eng
1418 Eutaw Place
Baltimore
Dear Sir
div1.p:
I have today seen
an article in the Outlook
of June 29th, suggesting that
private contributions for the
help of J R Kissinger, the
volunteer subject for some
of Dr Reed's experiments with
the yellow fever mosquito,
should be sent to you. It
gives me great pleasure
to enclose $10.00.

While believing that
the pension laws should be
strictly interpreted, I also
believe that the public is
under such obligation of
gratitude to the volunteers
for scientific experiment that
it is a duty as well as a privilege
for those who have any interests
in the tropics to subscribe in
such a case as Kissinger's, and
if he or his wife should be in
straits I should be glad to be
notified that further subscriptions
are needed. My address after
the next few weeks will be
535 Beacon St Boston
